item.title: 美国可能对铜征收关税，国内产业损失惨重
item.description: 分析人士称，美国可能对铜征收关税，美国工业部门将损失最大，因为在恢复国内铜矿开采和提炼的漫长过程中，成本将大幅上升。【原文：The U.S. industrial sector will have the most to lose from potential U.S. tariffs on copper, analysts say, with costs seen rising significantly during what would be a lengthy process of reviving domestic mining and refining of the metal.】

item.title: 美国百威啤酒和米其林啤酒价格暂时不受关税影响
item.description: Anheuser-Busch InBev 首席执行官 Michel Doukeris 周三表示，铝关税在 2025 年不会对百威和 Michelob Ultra 等啤酒的美国价格产生重大影响，但可能会在晚些时候产生影响。【原文：Tariffs on aluminium should not have a major impact on the U.S. prices of beers like Budweiser and Michelob Ultra in 2025, but could at a later date, Anheuser-Busch InBev CEO Michel Doukeris said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国电信首席执行官呼吁即将上任的德国政府和欧洲投资人工智能
item.description: 德国电信（Deutsche Telekom）首席执行官周三呼吁德国即将上任的政府和欧洲在人工智能（AI）和数据中心的发展方面发挥更大的领导作用，以便与美国和亚洲竞争。【原文：The chief executive of Deutsche Telekom on Wednesday called on Germany's incoming government and Europe to take on more leadership in the development of artificial intelligence (AI) and data centres to compete with the U.S. and Asia.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁征收药品关税，礼来计划投资270亿美元在美国新建工厂
item.description: 礼来制药公司（Eli Lilly）周三在华盛顿举行的新闻发布会上表示，该公司计划斥资至少270亿美元在美国新建四家生产厂，以应对特朗普政府征收药品进口关税的威胁。【原文：Eli Lilly plans to spend at least $27 billion to build four new manufacturing plants in the U.S., the drugmaker said at a Washington press conference on Wednesday, as it grapples with the threat of drug import duties from the Trump administration.】

item.title: 欧盟促进清洁技术发展、降低能源费用的计划有哪些内容？
item.description: 欧盟委员会周三提议提供 1,000 亿欧元（1,049.7 亿美元）用于支持欧盟制造的清洁制造业，同时采取措施降低电费。【原文：The European Commission proposed on Wednesday to make 100 billion euros ($104.97 billion) available to support EU-made clean manufacturing along with measures to lower power bills.】

item.title: 乌克兰称已与美国达成矿产协议
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）预计将于周五访问华盛顿，在此之前，乌克兰表示已达成一项 "初步 "协议，将其部分矿产资源收入交给美国。【原文：Ukraine said it had reached a "preliminary" deal to hand revenue from some of its mineral resources to the United States, before an expected trip to Washington by President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Friday.】

item.title: 美国制药商默克公司高管表示将增加在印度的员工人数
item.description: 默克制药公司（Merck，在美国和加拿大以外称为 MSD）的一位高级管理人员周三表示，该公司预计将在今年年底前增加其在印度各生产基地的员工人数。【原文：Drugmaker Merck , known as MSD outside of the U.S. and Canada, expects to increase its workforce across its India sites by the end of the year, a senior company executive said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯的稀土金属雄心何在？
item.description: 弗拉基米尔-普京总统在未来的经济协议中向美国提供了共同勘探俄罗斯稀土金属矿藏的机会。【原文：President Vladimir Putin has offered the U.S. the opportunity under a future economic deal to jointly explore Russia's rare earth metal deposits that he says are greater than those of Ukraine.】

item.title: 联合信贷银行首席执行官奥塞尔的年薪猛增 30%，达到 1300 万欧元
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）周二晚些时候在其网站上公布的文件中称，该行首席执行官安德里亚-奥塞尔（Andrea Orcel）去年的薪酬增加了近三分之一，达到 1320 万欧元（1380 万美元），其中包括一次性股票奖励。【原文：UniCredit Chief Executive Andrea Orcel's pay package rose by almost a third last year to 13.2 million euros ($13.8 million) including a one-off share award, the Italian bank said in documents published on its website late on Tuesday.】

item.title: 什么是稀土金属，为什么对它们有需求？
item.description: 随着从智能手机到风力涡轮机等产品需求的增长，以及各国政府寻求安全供应的努力，稀土金属正成为头条新闻。【原文：Rare earth metals are making headlines as demand rises for products from smartphones to wind turbines, and as governments seek secure supply.】

item.title: 巴西 Ambev 公司第四季度利润增长，预计未来将出现波动
item.description: 巴西酿酒商 Ambev 周三报告称，尽管总销量有所下降，但其第四季度调整后净利润仍增长了 7.5%，推动其股价走高，尽管该公司表示 2025 年的波动性 "仍将是一个现实"。【原文：Brazilian brewer Ambev on Wednesday reported a 7.5% increase in its fourth-quarter adjusted net profit despite a decline in total volumes, driving its shares higher even as it flagged that volatility will "remain a reality" in 2025.】

item.title: AerCap 首席执行官认为，如果市场重新开放，俄罗斯前景喜忧参半
item.description: 全球最大的飞机租赁公司 AerCap 的负责人周三表示，如果市场重新开放，俄罗斯可能会寻求购买整机或发动机，但租赁和零部件交易需要更长时间才能恢复。【原文：The head of the world's largest aircraft leasing company, AerCap , said on Wednesday that Russia may look to buy whole aircraft or engines if and when its markets reopen, but that leasing and parts-trading would take longer to resume.】

item.title: FACTBOX 美国公司宣布裁员以削减成本
item.description: 继去年出现类似的裁员行动后，美国各行各业的公司纷纷开始裁员，试图在经济不确定的情况下精简业务。【原文：U.S. companies have initiated layoffs across sectors as they attempt to streamline operations amid economic uncertainties, following similar cutbacks seen last year.】

item.title: -美国和乌克兰关于开发关键矿产的框架协议
item.description: 以下是乌克兰和美国关于共同开发稀土、关键矿物、石油、天然气和其他自然资源的框架协议全文。【原文：Following is the full text of a framework agreement between Ukraine and the United States on the joint development of rare earths, critical minerals, oil, gas and other natural resources.】

item.title: 数据分析需求强劲，Verisk 季度利润超预期
item.description: Verisk Analytics 周三公布的第四季度利润好于预期，原因是保险公司用于评估保单风险的数据分析产品需求强劲。【原文：Verisk Analytics reported a better-than-expected profit for the fourth quarter on Wednesday, driven by strong demand for its data analytics products used by insurers to assess policy risks.】

item.title: 特朗普称苹果应取消多元化政策
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三敦促苹果公司废除其多元化、公平和包容政策，而在此前一天，这家 iPhone 制造商的股东们在保守派团体日益强烈的反对声中投票决定保留这些政策。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday urged Apple to scrap its diversity, equity and inclusion policies, a day after the iPhone maker's shareholders voted to keep them in the face of growing pushback from conservative groups.】

item.title: 消费者支出疲软，TJX 预测年销售额增长低于预期
item.description: 周三，TJX Cos 预测其年度可比销售额增长低于华尔街预期，这表明该非价格零售商在严峻的经济形势下正在与预算意识较强的顾客减少消费作斗争。【原文：TJX Cos forecast its annual comparable sales growth below Wall Street estimate on Wednesday, in a sign the off-price retailer battles reduced spending from budget-conscious customers in a tough economy.】

item.title: 意大利在劳动力供应调查中没收 DHL 4900 万美元
item.description: 检察官的文件显示，意大利警方从物流巨头德国邮政敦豪（DHL）在当地的一个部门扣押了 4680 万欧元（4910 万美元），这是对涉嫌与非法劳动力供应有关的税务欺诈行为进行的最新调查的一部分。【原文：Italian police have seized 46.8 million euros ($49.1 million) from a local unit of logistics giant Deutsche Post DHL as part of the latest investigation into alleged tax fraud linked to illicit labour supply, prosecutors' documents showed.】

item.title: 标准普尔500指数2025年底将上涨9%，但与特朗普相关的不确定性因素增多
item.description: 路透社民意调查显示，股票策略师认为，2025 年美国 500 指数将上涨约 9%，但波动性可能会增加，因为唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布的一系列关税、裁员和政策变化会加剧不确定性。【原文：The S&P 500 will finish 2025 up about 9% from now, but volatility will likely increase as a barrage of tariff announcements, job cuts and policy changes from President Donald Trump fuels uncertainty, according to equity strategists in a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 乌克兰概述美国矿产交易
item.description: 乌克兰总理透露了与美国达成的矿产协议草案的细节，称其措辞表明华盛顿支持基辅获得安全保障的努力，但目前还没有更具体的内容。【原文：Ukraine's prime minister disclosed the details of a draft minerals deal with the United States, saying its wording showed Washington backed Kyiv's effort to get security guarantees, but touting nothing more concrete for now.】

item.title: 至关重要的 Nvidia 财报为摇摇欲坠的 "华丽七重奏 "指明方向
item.description: 随着科技公司收紧数据中心支出，周三发布的被视为人工智能芯片需求晴雨表的英伟达（Nvidia）财报可能会成为人工智能股票的一个拐点。【原文：Nvidia's much-awaited results - seen as a barometer of AI chip demand - on Wednesday could prove to be an inflection point for artificial intelligence stocks as technology companies tighten data center spending.】

item.title: 人工智能初创企业布里奇顿研究公司最新融资 1900 万美元
item.description: 人工智能初创公司布里奇敦研究公司（Bridgetown Research）周三表示，该公司已在一轮融资中筹集到1900万美元，该轮融资由风险投资公司光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）和加速投资（Accel）领投，一家知名研究型大学也参与了投资。【原文：Artificial Intelligence startup Bridgetown Research said on Wednesday it had raised $19 million in a funding round led by venture capital firms Lightspeed Venture Partners and Accel, with participation from a leading research university.】

item.title: 继穆迪下调评级后，惠誉将日产汽车评级降至垃圾级
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）周三表示，已将日产汽车的评级从 BBB- 下调至垃圾级 BB+，原因是这家日本汽车制造商 "盈利能力持续低下，复苏轨迹延迟，与我们的预期不符"。【原文：Fitch Ratings said on Wednesday it has downgraded Nissan Motor's rating to junk-status BB+ from BBB-, referring to the Japanese automaker's "persistently low profitability, with a delayed recovery trajectory against our expectations".】

item.title: 3M 在投资者日之前重申 2025 年销售额预期
item.description: 3M 公司周三表示，这家多元化制造商预计到 2027 年营业利润率将达到 25% 左右，并重申其年度有机销售额增长预期在 2% 至 3% 之间。【原文：3M Co said on Wednesday the diversified manufacturer expects operating margin to be about 25% by 2027 and reaffirmed its annual forecast of organic sales growth in the range of 2% to 3%.】

item.title: Wolters Kluwer 长期首席执行官麦金斯特里将退休，股价暴跌
item.description: 荷兰信息服务公司 Wolters Kluwer 表示其长期首席执行官 Nancy McKinstry 将于明年初退休，该公司股价周三下跌约 9%。【原文：Shares in Wolters Kluwer fell around 9% on Wednesday after the Dutch information services firm said its long-time CEO Nancy McKinstry would retire early next year.】

item.title: 通用汽车将把股息提高 25%，再回购 60 亿美元股票
item.description: 通用汽车公司周三表示，将把季度股息提高 25%，并实施一项新的 60 亿美元股票回购计划，以返还多余现金并增加股东价值。【原文：General Motors said on Wednesday it would increase its quarterly dividend by 25% and undertake a new $6 billion share buyback program to return excess cash and increase shareholder value.】

item.title: 华尔街大跌后期货上涨；特朗普的减税计划成为焦点
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货走高，从之前几个交易日的大幅下跌中反弹，投资者关注备受期待的减税计划在国会的进展，并等待人工智能巨头英伟达（Nvidia）的重要业绩。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Wednesday, rebounding from steep losses in the previous sessions, as investors focused on the progress of a highly anticipated tax-cut plan through Congress and awaited crucial results from AI powerhouse Nvidia.】

item.title: 顾问称，特朗普的 500 万美元 "金卡 "签证不太可能吸引富有的投资者
item.description: 移民和财富顾问表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的500万美元所谓 "金卡 "签证计划不太可能引发全球富裕投资者大量涌入美国寻求入籍，因为他们担心税率会提高。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's $5 million so-called 'gold card' visa program is unlikely to trigger a major inflow of wealthy global investors seeking U.S citizenship because of concerns over higher taxes, immigration and wealth advisers said.】

item.title: 美国：信心受挫的股市找到立足点，Nvidia 备受期待
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 特朗普为卡特尔贴上恐怖主义标签，提高了公司被起诉的风险
item.description: 在拉丁美洲部分地区运营的美国公司有可能遭到美国起诉。【原文：There is a risk of U.S. prosecutions for American companies operating in parts of Latin America.】
